list_definition.definition: to force (water) from (material) by twisting or by pressure

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He wrung the water from his soaking-wet shirt.

list_definition.definition: to clasp and unclasp (one’s hands) in desperation, fear etc.

list_ex_of_english: Everybody wrings their hands about this and says how deplorable it is.
Every concession had to be wrung from them.
They were wringing their hands in despair when unemployment was half what it is today and saying that something should be done.
I sincerely hope that they will not be wringing my hands and theirs when the test comes.
They will be wringing their hands before very long.
I accept that that is justified by the manifesto, but my withers are not particularly wrung by the force of that argument.
He reminded us of how our withers were wrung.
We are all wringing our hands in despair over what is, in effect, the very dividend of civilisation.
